turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Ajanta Caves.
turn.1: What are the main murals of Ajanta Caves?
turn.2: The scenes depicted are mostly didactic, devotional, and ornamental, with scenes from the [[Jataka]] stories of the Buddha's former lives as a [[bodhisattva]], the life of the [[Gautama Buddha]], and those of his veneration.
turn.3: What are the most famous murals?
turn.4: The two most famous individual painted images at Ajanta are the two over-life-size figures of the protective bodhisattvas [[Padmapani]] and [[Vajrapani]] on either side of the entrance to the Buddha shrine on the wall of the rear aisle (see illustrations above).
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Other significant frescos in Cave 1 include the Sibi, Sankhapala, Mahajanaka, Mahaummagga, and Champeyya Jataka tales.
turn.7: Is there another section on the other frescos?
turn.8: The cave-paintings also show the Temptation of Mara, the miracle of Sravasti where the Buddha simultaneously manifests in many forms, the story of Nanda, and the story of Siddhartha and Yasodhara.
turn.9: Are there any other notable murals?
turn.10: Cave 2, adjacent to Cave 1, is known for the paintings that have been preserved on its walls, ceilings, and pillars.
turn.11: What do the paintings look like?
turn.12: It looks similar to Cave 1 and is in a better state of preservation.
